alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Hand; Hughes; Hyde; Jones; Lyman; Stanley; Sully (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 12:58PM MST until January 19 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM CST /8 PM MST/ THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST /8 AM MST/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph could reduce visibility in blowing snow to as low as one half mile at times. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central South Dakota. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST /5 AM MST/ Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM CST /8 PM MST/ this evening to 9 AM CST /8 AM MST/ Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will reduce visibility at times tonight. The hazardous conditions will impact the commute this evening and possibly in the morning. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Hand; Hughes; Hyde; Jones; Lyman; Stanley; Sully
